page.title: 01Austerlands 1
page.content: The area known as{Austerlands}and {Scouthead}lies about 280 metres above sea level alongside the A62, which was one of the main roads linking {Lancashire}with{Yorkshire}until the construction of the M62 motorway. Until boundary reorganization, Austerlands was the actual boundary between the counties and the original stone boundary marker is still in place.Now the area is included within the boundaries of the town of{OLDHAM. Here you can see the change between town and country; the factory chimneys and built up area of the towns to the southwest and the open land of the Pennines to the northeast. There are still a few of the old stone cottages of the original villages, but many of these have become surrounded by modern developments. The area has few services; relying
